p: These features, along with additional benefits of minimized operator and environmental contamination, may have important implications in the context of an IPM program. Nevertheless, most ULV applications applied in pest management are using special oil-based of conventional pesticide formulations and although bio-rational compounds are potentially important elements in plant protection and in any IPM program [ [31], [32], [33], [34]] there is not much evidence (either in lab or field) of the potential bioactivity of natural compounds and particularly the use of ULV of essential oils against moth species.
